intro: Fuirena mauritiana var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fuirena, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, showing adaptability to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
